comment: Slightly boring "collect different kinds of cards" game. "Funnily" named cards with a beans in space theme to them, not-so-great illustrations.
One of the worst expansions for me.

Incredibly bland. It's not bad, and will not hesitate to play if asked, but there's nothing about it that's memorable. It's just a game that has a functional set of rules.

Rating: 
Optimal number of players:
 3
 2, 5~6

For more information on how I rate games, go to my profile

This is a filler game with some simple strategic elements. The character art on the cards is nice. Draw 0 or 2 cards on your turn. Then score your face up pile if possible and you desire. Next play matching colored cards into the face down or face up stacks. Finally pass your cards to the right, but play proceeds to the left. Only score if you have the same number of cards that match a number on one of the cards in the pile. There is strategy in keeping your scoring stack playable, but it can get annoying if you are not getting the cards you need. Also not knowing the other player's face down stacks adds to the unpredictability. More players add to the challenge.
There's a good game in there somewhere...

As someone who didn't like Bohnanza at all, Space Beans is alright. It still has some of the same frustrations of Bohnanza, like being forced to plant each turn. On the other hand, not having a set hand order is fantastic, and the way that fields score is actually pretty clever. I am much more willing to play this sequel than the original game, although I'm still not wild about Uwe Rosenberg games in general.
Best if played _fast_. Slow play breaks this game down a lot, since it becomes too easy to memorize everything that's going on.
Amazing little game and was a throw in trade!
Rosenberg's best game. In terms of fun to time commitment ratio. Possibly period.
